heading.content: Launching the Eiffel for .NET Compliance Checker

paragraph.paragraph: To run the tool simply launch the ec_checker.exe executable file from Windows Explorer any other file manager. Alternatively ec_checker.exe may be run from a command-line shell.
Launching the tool either from a file manager or via a command-line shell will present the Eiffel for .NET Compliance Checker window.
The compliance checker supports passing of an assembly file name and reference path(s) (more on these later), via the command-line. The following indicates the command-line usage:
The first argument (assembly_file_name) must always be the path to an assembly. All additional arguments are treated as assembly dependency reference paths.

list.item: assembly_file_name is the file name of the assembly you would like to check with the tool. This path may be relative or absolute.
path_1/path_nth are the paths to look in for the assembly dependencies.
